definition: thick/deep or profound/kind/generous/rich or strong in flavor/to favor/to stress

sentences.english: Second, you must not be shy, be thick-skinned, and speak up.
sentences.chinese: 其次，別害羞，臉皮厚一點，大聲說出來。

sentences.english: I am now so thick-skinned that such incidents hardly fuss me at all.
sentences.chinese: 我現在的臉皮厚得很，這樣的情形對我已經無所謂了。

sentences.english: Sometimes you'll just have to deal with Internet meanies and grow that thick skin.
sentences.chinese: 有事你只是需要對待網絡刻薄鬼並且變得臉皮厚一點。
論臉皮厚，你可算是天下第一。

sentences.english: He's really thick-skinned, Insults roll right off his back;
sentences.chinese: 他真是臉皮厚，羞辱的話他是毫不在乎。

sentences.english: You need a thick skin to be a headmaster.
sentences.chinese: 要當校長，你就得臉皮厚一些。

sentences.english: She has had so much criticism by now that she has learned how to be thick-skinned.
sentences.chinese: 她受到太多的批評譴責，只是她學會了臉皮厚而已。

sentences.english: The smelly man who looking at these thick-skinneds, snow Niang found out a target a while.
sentences.chinese: 看着這羣臉皮厚的臭男人，雪娘一下子找到了目標。

sentences.english: It's really time to grow a thicker skin.
sentences.chinese: 真是到了該臉皮厚一點的時刻了。

definition: to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other
to act shamelessly/to refuse to acknowledge that one has lost the game, or made a promise etc/to act dumb/to act as if sth never happened
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to lose money instead of being paid (i.e. sb should pay me, but is actually taking my money)
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile

pinyin: zheng1 yi1 zhi1 yan3 bi4 yi1 zhi1 yan3

definition: lit. going round the curves and skirting the corners (idiom)/fig. to speak in a roundabout way/to equivocate/to beat about the bush
